Hi,

I've tested a similiar report in my environment:
OS:WinXP
JDK:1.5.0_07
GlassFish:V2 Beta3
Birt version:birt-runtime-2_2_0 RC4
The report works well in GlassFish. I've never met the exception you've got, so could you please try the report design I attached? The difference between my report and yours is that you use the JNDI as your data source. So if the attached report works fine in your side, it might be the problem of your JNDI Data source. Waiting for your response. Thanks.

Mingxia

Created an attachment (id=74116)
Modified report design

Hi,
using the report with BIRT example DB works fine, but with oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver it does not.
I have switched to birt-runtime 2.2.0, there is no exception in the server.log anymore.

using JNDI the combobox prompt is filled correctly, but the report is empty.
I think the JNDI it setup correctly otherwise the prompt would be empty too.

if I remove <property name="odaJndiName">jdbc/birtTest</property> the prompt is not filled.

there are probably two issues here:
- JNDI returns values for prompts, but not for report (only Glassfish, Bea8 works)
- data sources with
 <property name="odaDriverClass">oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver</property> 
 do not work (Glassfish and Bea)

Please let me know if I can provide further information to track down this issue.

Regards
Christian

Hi,

I switch to Oracle database and it also works fine in my environment.I wonder whether you put the oracle driver jar file under the classpath? Do you find any error log in GLASSFISH_DIRECTORY\domains\domain1\applications\j2ee-modules\birt\logs?

Thanks
Mingxia

Hi,

my domain.xml contains  <java-config classpath-suffix="/home/myhome/ojdbc14.jar"
birt/log and server.log does not contain errors.
I wonder why the combobox gets filled???

Regards
Christian

Hi,

Do you mean you could see the parameter comboBox value list when previewing the report, but the report design shows empty? How many rows do you fetch from your database?
Do you still get the #Description's exception in Bea10 using the latest birt-runtime?


Thanks
Mingxia

Hi,

I' using Birt designer from Eclipse Europa edition. 

Simple DataSet "myDataSet" query, something like
select col_1 from table where col_1 = ?

Two DataSources (table is installed in both databases and contains 3 rows)
- Source1: local Derby database
- Source2: Oracle DB

myDataSet with Source1 -> ComboBox fetches values, Report shows results
myDataSet with Source2 -> ComboBox fetches values, Report is empty

Suse9;Bea8; birt-runtime-2.2.0
myDataSet with Source2 -> ComboBox fetches values, Report shows results

Suse9;Glassfish v2 b57; birt-runtime-2.2.0
myDataSet with Source2 -> ComboBox fetches values, Report is empty


Is there a log where I can see the query that gets sent to the DB?

Regards
Christian

Hi,

You could change the BIRT Log level in web.xml to see the query passed to db. For example, in glassfish, under GLASSFISH_DIRECTORY\domains\domain1\applications\j2ee-modules\birt\WEB-INF, modify web.xml's
	<!-- Report engine log level -->
	<context-param>
		<param-name>BIRT_VIEWER_LOG_LEVEL</param-name>
		<param-value>WARNING</param-value>
	</context-param>
into
	<!-- Report engine log level -->
	<context-param>
		<param-name>BIRT_VIEWER_LOG_LEVEL</param-name>
		<param-value>FINE</param-value>
	</context-param>
Then you could see more detailed log info in GLASSFISH_DIRECTORY\domains\domain1\applications\j2ee-modules\birt\logs.

Thanks
Mingxia

It seems that it does not fetch any column value from ResultSet in GlassFish because it doesn't do wasNull() check on next(). So could you please change the log level into FINEST? I need more highly detailed tracing message on this issue.


Thanks
Mingxia

Hi,

I've changed the logging level to FINEST, but there is no more usefull information provided. 

I was using ojdbc14.jar from Oracle 10g, if I switch to ojdbc14.jar from Oracle 9i I cannot reproduce the problem in Glassfish. This workaround seams not to work for the designer.

Regards
Christian

Hi,

Which oracle version do you use?If your oracle is 9i, I think you'd better use its corresponding ojdbc14.jar(ojdbc14.jar for 9i).And you never reproduce this bug with its corresponding driver, right?
In birt designer, if you don't exit birt, birt will always use the first loaded driver, that is, even you switch to ojdbc14.jar for oracle 9i, it still use the old one driver. This is a known bug, you can refer to:
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=191404


Thanks
Mingxia

Hi,

My point is that you should use the corresponding driver for your Oracle db, say ojdbc14.jar for Oracle10g in your case. If it still doesn't work, it might be Birt's bug, or if you try to use 9i driver for 10g oracle, we cannot assure it works properly due to the support of jdbc driver.

Thanks
Mingxia
